intro: Gymnosporia harveyana subsp. stolzii, commonly known as the Harvey's burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resistance to drought. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and for ecological studies.
